body.section:
Most applications have the need for an integrated full-text search to increase usability. For the java world there is an excelent solution called lucene. The only problem is that lucene is a little low level and leaves you with some typical problems like indexing binary file-formats.
This project is a solution for the gap:
mmm-search-indexer provides an indexer that recursively indexes locations. It supports incremental indexing and can be configured to your needs via some XML configuration file.
mmm-search-engine provides API and implementation for a consistent search solution that abstracts from lucene.
This project is a little similar to Apache Solr. However this project has quite a different approach. The key benefits of this solution are:
incremental indexing support
automatic unicode detection
central definition of schema
central and flexible configuration
clean API
excellent Javadocs
